sentences.en: All the criticism is water off a duck's back to me.
sentences.cn: 批评对我来说左耳进右耳出，毫无影响。

sentences.en: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.cn: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.en: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.cn: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.en: Doubtless he was justified in some of his criticism of the media.
sentences.cn: 他对媒体的一些批评性言论无疑是合乎情理的。

sentences.en: He is still smarting over criticism of his victorious but clumsy performance.
sentences.cn: 他还在为别人批评他尽管最终胜出但表现笨拙感到闷闷不乐。

sentences.en: He was shattered and bewildered by this trenchant criticism.
sentences.cn: 他因这番尖锐的批评而万念俱灰，茫然不知所措。

sentences.en: He's a sensitive lad and some of the criticism has stung him.
sentences.cn: 他是个敏感的小伙子，有些批评刺痛了他。

sentences.en: Her literary criticism focuses on the way great literature suggests ideas.
sentences.cn: 她的文学批评集中关注的是伟大的文学作品表达思想的方式。

sentences.en: Her work is open to the criticism that it is ethnocentric.
sentences.cn: 她的作品可能会被指责带有种族中心主义色彩。

sentences.en: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.cn: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.en: His face was expressionless, but Alex felt the unspoken criticism.
sentences.cn: 他面无表情，但亚历克斯能感觉到他未明言的批评之意。

sentences.en: Listen to criticism but don't be crushed by it.
sentences.cn: 听取批评意见，但不要被它击垮。

sentences.en: literary criticism
sentences.cn: 文学评论

sentences.en: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.cn: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.en: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.cn: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.en: The long-anticipated study drew criticism from the tobacco industry.
sentences.cn: 让人期待已久的研究遭到了烟草行业的批评。

sentences.en: The minister suffered yet another torrid day of criticism.
sentences.cn: 在不绝于耳的批评声中，这位部长又挨过了难熬的一天。

sentences.en: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.cn: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.en: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.cn: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.en: There was a crescendo of parliamentary and press criticism.
sentences.cn: 来自议会和新闻界的批评越来越多。

sentences.en: There was no criticism of her work until after she was downgraded.
sentences.cn: 在被降职前她的工作从未受过批评。

sentences.en: This was the most biting criticism made against her.
sentences.cn: 这是对她最尖锐的批评。

sentences.en: We must respond to well-founded criticism with a willingness to change.
sentences.cn: 对于有根有据的批评，我们必须乐意作出改变。

sentences.en: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.cn: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.en: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.cn: 你必须学会接受批评。

words.tran_cn: 鉴定的；[核] 临界的；批评的，爱挑剔的；危险的；决定性的；评论的
精密地；危急地；批评性地；用钻研眼光地
批评家，评论家；爱挑剔的人

trans.tran_cn: 批判，指责，(书籍或音乐等)评论
trans.tran_en: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something
